p: Although SARS-CoV-2 is less lethal than MERS-CoV, as many as 20% of the infected people develop rapidly a severe disease characterized by interstitial pneumonia and acute respiratory distress syndrome that can ultimately lead to death. This is particularly reported in elderly and in people with underlying medical conditions. However, most of the patients remain asymptomatic or develop mild symptoms, like fever and dry cough, followed then by breathing difficulties (dyspnea), and bilateral ground-glass opacities on chest CT scans, indicating that the target cells are located in the lower airways [ 8].
